briefTitle: Efficacy & Safety of Inhaled Insulin in Type 1 Diabetes
officialTitle: A Prospective, Multi-Center, Open-Label, Randomized, Controlled Clinical Trial Comparing the Efficacy and Safety in Subjects With Type 1 Diabetes Receiving Subcutaneous Basal Insulin and Prandial Inhalation of Technosphere/Insulin Versus Subcutaneous Basal and Prandial Insulin Over a 52-Week Treatment Period and a 4-Week Follow Up
summary: To determine the safety and efficacy of inhaled insulin in the treatment of type 1 diabetes

primaryOutcome.measure: Compare the Mean Change From Baseline to Week 52 in HbA1c
